review_title: Great pizza and great for Vegan Pizza
review_text: Great pizza with speciality Vegan / Gluten-free options at reasonable price for three with sharing Bruschetta starter and sodas for $80
Stopped in for a quick meal while touring downtown Gatlinburg. The staff was friendly, the atmosphere was nice. The food was delicious.
We had a gluten free pizza and a small buffalo chicken. Both were excellent. Our server, Ashlynn, did a great job as well! The same great pizza we get at home in a beautiful setting.

review_title: Gf pizza/specialty pizza just for my sonðŸ˜Š/family enjoyment/ great daiquiri
review_text:
This was awesome experience especially for my son. The bartender/waiter made my sons night made him a pizza just for him and my son loved it! He said it was the best pizza ever!

Nice atmosphere and great pizzas and drinks all around. My husband had a gf pizza and he loved it wasn't sick after. I give this place 10/10 not only for gluten clients but for my son that got personal pizza just for him. I forgot the waiter/ bartenders name.

We had decided to grab a slice a pizza and had some issues at a couple other places we had stopped at when we found this place. Though we weren't looking for a sit-down meal, we are glad we didn't miss this place. The best...pizza we have had in a while.
Had pizza and salads for lunch. Pizza was very good and salad was fresh. Would return when back in the area

The pizza here was amazing! And the pretzel bites for the appetizer with beer cheese. We will be definitely coming back! They do have an elevator located near the moon shine still for handicap accessible and strollers to access the upstairs part of the restaurant.
We were in for Jeep Invasion and figured it would be a long wait, but we were seated in a timely manner, our server was great and very helpful, food was fantastic, we'll be back next year.

We stopped in for a bite and a drink to watch the football game while on our weekend in Gatlinburg TN. Brit and Mike were great and super friendly. Brit fixed my drink for me after I discovered I didn't like the sour taste, she...made it taste better!
The pizzas and drinks were awesome, and we got a spot right next to the balcony for great people-watching.

review_title: Great pizza and many vegan options
review_text: Great food and drinks! Many good vegan options which was appreciated. We went on a Monday night which wasn't crowded and the service was good. Very large portions.

review_title: Not worth the wait or putting up with unfriendly servers!
review_text: Very unfriendly almost rude staff. Needed to place an order to go, told to go to another station, again another unfriendly server. Small pizza consisted of 4 pieces and way overpriced! Order took forever.
Had a wonderful time and fun experience. Love Dudes Daiquiris and the pizza! Will definitely return. Thanks for the laughs and good time!!!

Hubs had 2 appetizers, mushroom soup and garlic parmesan chicken wings. I had the Cobb salad with Bleu cheese dressing. Hubs food was delicious. My salad was perfect and fresh. We were seated right by the window so we could see everything going on. Prices...were good. Everything was clean and service was great. We would eat here again.

We got into town late and Mellow mushroom was one of the only places still seating. It was a happy surprise because their gluten free pizza is amazing. We order one gluten free and one build your own to share between four adults. It was so good but so much we couldn't eat it all. ThatÃ¢Â€Â™s okay. Left over pizza for breakfast for the win

Mellow is a chain so you know what you're going to be getting here. But, the Mellow in Gatlinburg stays open later than the majority of the local eateries. So if you're looking for a place to get a bite to eat after 9 p.m. Mellow is the place to go. Plus the wait staff was super nice and courteous.

If you didn't know, Gatlinburg is a tourist place. That means lots of people and paying for parking and walking. On a hot day, that put me in a bad mood. We stopped here because it was not a far walk and they had seating available.

I don't know enough about pizza to be a snob but it was pretty much what I expect from pizza. A few in my party said the crust/bread was excellent. Unfortunately, we didn't try anything other than pizza though I do believe cost would have become a factor for me.

The best parts...indoors bathroom for customers was cool and clean. And the gal who waited on us was definitely above average. Not in a touristy way, but in the she's-actually-decent-at-her job kinda way. Wish I'd gotten her name to give her praise.

The best pizza we have ever had...we were on vacation and had lunch one day and returned for dinner before we headed home. Service was amazing and great sweet tea. Will definitely eat there again when we return.

The staff is very creepy they would literally stare at us while we ate our waitress was nice but they need to teach the staff to not stare at the other tables they aren't waiting on. It was a creepy vibe
We sat at the bar and had a few drinks but felt rushed the entire time. Our bartender was awesome tho, really quick with anything we asked.
Delicious pizza, servers are very kind and attentive. The drinks are so good must try them. Shiitake pizza with bacon is the bomb !!

The "parmesan bites" (they aren't pretzels) were delicious, as was the cheese dip served with them.

Pizza was good but they are stingy with the toppings as you can see in the photo...very little toppings....There was a taste to the cheese I didn't care for. I loved the crust though! Save the cheese dip from the bread for the pizza crust. It was just the right amount of Crispy and Chewy and very tasty.

Service was...eh...waitress was sweet, new, and there was a language barrier but she really tried and did a good job at it. Host kept trying to sit us outside...who eats pizza outside when it's 90 degrees? They didn't seem thrilled that we didn't want to eat outside.

They don't give, or advertise, a kids menu....but they do have kids Mac N Cheese for those who don't like Pizza and it was really cheesy and good.
We spent an evening at the Island and wanted an easy dinner. This was some of the best pizza IÃ¢Â€Â™ve ever had.

review_title: The Best Pizza and Greek Salad
review_text: Gatlinburg was busy so we were grateful to be seated and greeted right away. We split the large Greek salad and it was absolutely delicious and was a generous serving. We had the mushroom pizza and the crust was perfect, it was cooked just right, and we were happy to have leftovers the next day. We would definitely return.
Being a NYer, IÃ¢Â€Â™m pretty picky about my pizza. Mellow Mushroom pizza was amazing! We had the Great White pizza and the Buffalo Chicken pizza plus pretzel bites. It was all delicious!

Stopped in because I wanted to try them the last few years and never did. Got myself a small buffalo chicken pizza and a soda. The waitress was attentive and brought everything in a timely manner. The pizza was excellent with real chicken on it..the spice was there but not overwhelming..the crust had a good crunch to it but still was a little chewy which is a good combo. Definitely will visit again and definitely recommend!

Stopped in here for lunch yesterday after touring the Hollywood Stars Cars Museum (super neat!). 3 adults and 2 teen boys. Everyone got pizza of some sort, also ordered pretzel bites. Everything was delicious a day the staff was very friendly. Neat little restaurant, highly recommend.

One of the better pizzas in our travels through Tennessee. We saw it in Chattanooga, and came to this one in Gatlinburg. You wont regret it........BTW we are pizza snobs. This place was great. We dont do Pizza Hut or national franchises. Please experience this place
Went to the Dudes Daiquiri and had an absolute blast with Mert. He was working the bar. Awesome attitude and just made our day. Thank you

Matt at the bar should be working across the street at Dick's Last Resort because he told my wife to leave our table when I got up to go to the bathroom and wouldn't serve her water or let her sit on the patio. Go to the Pigeon Forge location or just get a less sexist bartender.

My husband and I ordered a medium Buffalo chicken pizza. It was very good, best crust IÃ¢Â€Â™ve ever had on a pizza!

Server was very attentive and everything was served quickly. We will be back again!

review_title: Bring your wallet but expect good pizza!
review_text: Great pizza..just expensive. One medium house special, one small gluten free pizza, cheese bread, 3 drinks....$90 with a tip. ThatÃ¢Â€Â™s a lot in my opinion. But it was very good pizza. And friendly service.
My pizza was very good. Waiter was very friendly and helpful. Didn't have to wait too long for our food. Would ho back when IÃ¢Â€Â™m back in Gatlinburg.

We don't have a Mellow Mushroom by us. We stopped in for lunch and the food was so good!! We ended up getting takeout the day before we drove home (16 hours), so we could have leftover pizza in the car for our drive home. The pizza is amazing both hot and cold/leftover.

The shitake mushroom was amazing!!! BBQ pizza was also very good. We were there during spring break crush of people and waited 25 minutes or so, but their texting system worked out perfectly and we had time to sample the moonshine next door. Our waiter was very helpful and prompt. We always enjoy going here. Very happy.

I understand itÃ¢Â€Â™s h to e busiest week of the year here but our experience wasn't good. The food was great but service was terrible. We waited for drinks forever. A group sat after us and had their food before we had our drinks.

Looking for a great pizza while visiting Gatlinburg? The Mellow Mushroom is the place to go. The Gatlinburg location isn't the most "attractive" of the chain's locations but met our expectations in terms of a much-anticipated sausage and mushroom pizza. (We live in the Midwest and always look forward to finding a Mellow Mushroom during our southern travels.)

Our family of 7 stopped in at the mellow mushroom in the center of Gatlinburg, Tenn. I ordered a house special pizza to go. After having the house special pizza at the mellow mushroom Lexington, KY location where the pizza was absolutely the best pizza I've ever eaten. We leave and go to our cabin.My disappointment after opening the box and seeing a pizza that looked like a frozen store brand pizza at your local grocery store. The toppings were sparce with very little cheese, nothing at all like we get at the Lexingtonlocation. I guess the mellow mushroom in Gatlinburg is just another tourist trap. I'll go to the best Italian Cafe and Pizzeria where I know the pizza is outstanding.

Don't overlook this second floor offering. You can overlook the parkway while you enjoy a great pizza with numerous drink options. Our waiter knew his stuff and offered several recommendations upon our asking.
